# Listing available slash commands in VS Code Chat (2025-11-09 13:29Z)

_**User (2025-11-09 13:30Z)**_

I am speaking with you through the VSCode chat. Do you know how can I list the available slash commands in this environment?


---

_**Agent (model copilot/claude-sonnet-4.5)**_

To see the available slash commands in VS Code's chat interface, you can simply type `/` (a forward slash) in the chat input box, and VS Code will show you a dropdown list of all available commands.

Alternatively, you can look for common slash commands that are typically available in GitHub Copilot Chat:

- `/help` - Shows help information about using Copilot Chat
- `/explain` - Explains selected code
- `/fix` - Suggests fixes for problems in code
- `/tests` - Generates unit tests
- `/clear` - Clears the chat history
- `/new` - Starts a new chat session
- `/newNotebook` - Creates a new Jupyter notebook
- `/search` - Searches for information

The exact commands available may vary depending on your VS Code version and installed extensions. Just type `/` in the chat input to see what's available in your specific setup!

---
